meaning: To follow or obey rules or agreements
hindi_meaning: नियमों या समझौतों का पालन करना
usage_note: Common in legal or formal contexts
example: You must abide by the contract terms.

meaning: To take action based on advice or information
hindi_meaning: सुझाव या जानकारी के आधार पर कार्य करना
usage_note: Often used for decisions or suggestions
example: She acted on her doctor’s advice.

usage_note: Often used for machines or children
example: My laptop is acting up again.

meaning: To make sense; to calculate a total
example: Her story just doesn’t add up.

meaning: To have the same opinion or consent
example: They agree on the new plan.

usage_note: Used for goals or physical targets
example: She aimed at becoming a doctor.
The teacher allows questions during class.

usage_note: Often used for children or arguments
example: He answered back to his boss rudely.

meaning: To make a formal request; to put into use

example: They argued about politics all night.
Ignoring the rules is asking for trouble.

meaning: To invite someone on a date
example: He asked her out for dinner.

usage_note: Used for physical or figurative arrival

meaning: To be present at an event or place
To keep away from or prevent

example: The noise awakened the entire house.
She adapted quickly to the new city.
He advised her to study harder.

meaning: To influence or cause a change
To come near or address someone
usage_note: Used for physical or conversational contexts
Common in official or business contexts

meaning: To debate or dispute about something
usage_note: Used for specific topics or issues

meaning: To provide with tools or information
hindi_meaning: उपकरणों या जानकारी से लैस करना
example: She was armed with facts for the debate.
I asked around about the job opening.

usage_note: Used in professional or formal settings

example: He attempted to climb the mountain.
He backed off after the argument.

meaning: To support or make a copy
example: She backed up her files regularly.

meaning: To negotiate a price or deal
example: She bargained for a lower price.

meaning: To be in the right place or group

example: He blew up over the mistake.

usage_note: Used for cooking or figurative heat

meaning: To take something with intent to return
To separate into pieces; to interrupt
example: She broke the record for speed.

meaning: To stop functioning; to emotionally collapse
hindi_meaning: खराब होना; भावनात्मक रूप से टूटना
usage_note: Can refer to machines or emotions
example: The car broke down on the highway.

meaning: To enter forcibly; to train or adapt
example: She broke in her new shoes.
A fire broke out in the building.

meaning: To end a relationship; to disperse
example: They broke up after years together.

meaning: To raise a topic or child
usage_note: Can refer to parenting or discussion
example: She brought up an interesting point.

usage_note: Used for physical or abstract things

meaning: To set on fire or be consumed by fire

example: She backed away from the danger.
They bailed out the failing company.
She balances work and life well.

usage_note: Used in legal or official contexts
Often used for burdens or emotions
Common in casual or gambling contexts
example: She bet on the winning team.

usage_note: Commonly used for events or plans
example: They called off the meeting due to rain.

usage_note: Used for formal visits or classroom settings
example: The teacher called on her to answer.

usage_note: Can be used for casual calls or military contexts
example: She called up her friend to chat.

meaning: To become or make less agitated
example: He calmed down after the argument.

meaning: To look after or like something
example: She cares for her elderly parents.

hindi_meaning: जारी रखना या उत्साहित व्यवहार करना
usage_note: Can be formal or informal based on context
example: They carried on with the project.

meaning: To complete or perform a task
usage_note: Common in work or research contexts
example: They carried out the experiment successfully.

meaning: To reach the same level or reconnect
hindi_meaning: बराबर आना या फिर से जुड़ना
usage_note: Used for progress or social contexts
example: She caught up with her old friends.

meaning: To observe an event with festivities

hindi_meaning: पंजीकरण करना या आगमन की सूचना देना
usage_note: Common in travel or hotel contexts
example: We checked in at the hotel.

meaning: To investigate or leave a place
example: Let’s check out that new store.
She cheered up after the good news.
They cleaned up the room quickly.

meaning: To remove items or leave quickly
hindi_meaning: वस्तुओं को हटाना या जल्दी छोड़ना
example: They cleared out the old stock.

usage_note: Used for physical or figurative ascent

meaning: To find unexpectedly; to seem in a certain way
hindi_meaning: अप्रत्याशित रूप से मिलना; किसी तरह का लगना
example: She comes across as very confident.

hindi_meaning: वापस आना या फिर से लोकप्रिय होना
example: He came back after a long trip.
The topic came up in the meeting.

usage_note: Used for physical or abstract links

meaning: To give or add to a common purpose
example: She contributes to the team effort.

meaning: To become cooler or less angry
hindi_meaning: ठंडा होना या गुस्सा कम करना
example: He cooled off after the argument.
I count on her for help.

usage_note: Often used for secrets or mistakes

meaning: To make or produce something new
usage_note: Used for art, ideas, or objects

meaning: To cancel by drawing a line through
example: He crossed out the wrong answer.
He cut down the old tree.
The call was cut off suddenly.

meaning: To remove or stop doing something
usage_note: Used for habits or physical items
example: She cut out sugar from her diet.

meaning: To challenge or be brave enough
To handle or address a situation
example: He dealt with the issue quickly.

meaning: To make a choice or judgment
example: She decided to join the team.

meaning: To protect or argue in favor
usage_note: Used in legal or physical contexts

meaning: To rely on or be determined by
To find or learn something new
usage_note: Used for new knowledge or places

meaning: To eliminate or get rid of
example: They did away with the old policy.

meaning: To create a picture or attract

example: He dreams of becoming a pilot.

meaning: To wear formal or fancy clothes
example: She dressed up for the party.

meaning: To abandon a course or activity
To gain money or respect through effort

example: The rain eased off by afternoon.

usage_note: Used in academic or professional contexts
example: She educates children at the school.

meaning: To remove or get rid of
example: They eliminated errors from the report.

meaning: To gain money or respect through effort

example: The rain eased off by afternoon.

usage_note: Used in academic or professional contexts
example: She educates children at the school.

meaning: To remove or get rid of
example: They eliminated errors from the report.

meaning: To start a journey or project
example: They embarked on a new adventure.

hindi_meaning: गले लगाना या उत्साहपूर्वक स्वीकार करना

usage_note: Used in business or resource contexts

example: He encouraged her to try again.

meaning: To arrive at an unexpected place or situation
hindi_meaning: अप्रत्याशित स्थान या स्थिति में पहुंचना
example: They ended up in the wrong city.

usage_note: Used for physical or abstract entry
Used in academic or professional settings

hindi_meaning: माफ करना या औचित्य सिद्ध करना

meaning: To increase in size or scope
To anticipate or look forward to

usage_note: Used for time, space, or offers

meaning: To break into pieces or collapse emotionally
hindi_meaning: टुकड़ों में टूटना या भावनात्मक रूप से ढहना

meaning: To retreat or rely on reserve
hindi_meaning: पीछे हटना या रिजर्व पर निर्भर करना
usage_note: Used in military or backup contexts
example: They fell back to their plan B.

meaning: To lag or fail to keep up
example: She fell behind in her studies.

meaning: To quarrel or have a disagreement

example: She filled out the form quickly.

usage_note: Used for social or scheduling contexts
example: She fits in with the team.

meaning: To become ice or stop moving

example: They gathered flowers for the event.

usage_note: Used for energy, ideas, or data

example: She got her point across clearly.
He worked hard to get ahead.

meaning: To have a good relationship or manage
hindi_meaning: अच्छा संबंध रखना या प्रबंध करना
example: They get along well with neighbors.

meaning: To escape or take a break
example: They got away for the weekend.

hindi_meaning: वापस आना या कुछ पुनः प्राप्त करना
example: She got back her stolen phone.

usage_note: Used for financial or minimal resources
example: They get by on a small budget.
He got in the car quickly.

meaning: To leave a vehicle or avoid punishment
hindi_meaning: वाहन से उतरना या सजा से बचना
usage_note: Used for transport or legal contexts
example: She got off the bus at the station.

meaning: To board a vehicle or make progress
hindi_meaning: वाहन पर चढ़ना या प्रगति करना
usage_note: Used for transport or life progress
example: He got on the train early.
She gets up early every day.
He gave away his old clothes.

hindi_meaning: समर्पण करना या अनिच्छा से सहमत होना
example: He gave in to her demands.

hindi_meaning: वितरित करना या काम करना बंद करना
त्याग करना या प्रयास बंद करना

meaning: To return to a place or time
usage_note: Used for physical or mental return
example: She went back to her hometown.
The alarm went off at 6 AM.
He went through a tough time.
She grew up in a small town.

usage_note: Used for waiting or physical grip
example: Hang on, I’ll be there soon.
They hang out at the park.

meaning: To end a call or suspend

usage_note: Used for physical or emotional damage

hindi_meaning: नियुक्त करना या किराए पर लेना

usage_note: Used for physical or figurative impact
Used for waiting or physical grip

example: He hurried to catch the bus.

usage_note: Used for physical or emotional pain
Used for people, objects, or issues

meaning: To explain or decorate with images
To form a mental image or conceive
usage_note: Used for creative or hypothetical scenarios

hindi_meaning: गहराई से शामिल करना या डुबाना
example: He immersed himself in the book.

meaning: To bring in from another country

example: She informed him of the meeting.

usage_note: Used for social or system interactions

meaning: To present or bring into use
hindi_meaning: परिचय कराना या उपयोग में लाना

usage_note: Used for new ideas or devices

example: They invited her to the party.

usage_note: Used for physical or emotional shock

meaning: To form an opinion or decide
usage_note: Used for opinions or legal contexts

hindi_meaning: अचानक शुरू करना या शामिल होना

meaning: To handle multiple tasks or toss objects
usage_note: Used for tasks or circus acts

meaning: To make a harsh sound or irritate
usage_note: Used for metallic sounds or nerves
example: The keys jangled in his pocket.

usage_note: Used for physical or emotional shock

example: The news jolted her out of her thoughts.

meaning: To travel or go on a trip
To place side by side for comparison

usage_note: Used for physical or figurative discarding

example: The event kicked off at noon.
They kicked him out of the club.
She kidded him about his hair.

meaning: To stop work or produce quickly
hindi_meaning: काम बंद करना या जल्दी बनाना

example: She kicked back on the couch.
He kept up with the race.
